attributes.action: Make advertising in any form a fake job vacancy a serious offence
attributes.background: common practice within recruitment is to invent vacancies (even in some cases naming a real Company) to increase the number of CV's a recruitment agency has on file.  This completely wastes job-seekers time, effort, gives them false hope and distracts them from the real task of getting a job

attributes.action: 2017 to be the year that the UK start protecting native wildlife In our cities.
attributes.background: Our wildlife is losing it's natural habitat & struggling to adjust to our cities.In this unknown future in the UK due to Brexit.I ask you to firstly pledge your assurance to keep EU laws on our enviroment.Secondly, a guarantee that the goverment will help make our cities accessible to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: This is important for our wildlife in the UK.In Milan over 800 trees have been planted on rooftops & balconies resulting in species abundance growth.This could be achieved in the UK with help from university students of Enviromental sciences.This cuts costs &helps students develop skills& portfolios,which could lead to job growth.If achieved,this could attract tourists to cities throughout the UK& boost our economy.There is no doubt that our wildlife,worldwide is depleting at a dangerous rate.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for Under 25's to £7.50 in line with all other workers.
attributes.background: Young people can be paid considerably less for work than an adult, in the same role at the same company; U18's can be paid as little as £4.05 per hour & U21 £5.60; This pay gap is discriminatory legislation, which says YP are worth less than older citizens (Regardless of ability to perform the job.)
attributes.additional_details:
It's near impossible to live a decent quality of life on earnings around the minimum wage; So why for under 25's who work in the same roles as adults can be paid £3.45p/h less an hour despite being potentially better educated more capable than their adult counterparts. Many under 25's work their jobs to help low-income parents provide necessities and I feel this discriminatory legislation therefore unfairly targets the young people of low-income backgrounds who are just about managing to cover the costs of running a household...

I therefore petition the government for pay equity for under 25's.

attributes.action: The UK should follow Sweden, cut VAT for fixing goods rather than throwing away.
attributes.background: To combat its ‘throwaway consumer culture’, Sweden has announced tax breaks on repairs to clothes, bicycles, fridges and washing machines. Repairs are more labour-intense than production, which is largely automised, repairs actually contribute to an expanding labour market decreasing unemployment.
attributes.additional_details:
Jobs would be in the U.K. not abroad, they would be where you live & benefit the local economy.  Whereas large-scale manufacturing is very centralised. This will expand the number of companies giving these kinds of services so It’ll be easier for consumers to have things repaired.

It will be easier for people to buy high-quality products because they know it’s affordable to have them fixed if something breaks, giving an  incentive not to buy as cheap as possible and then scrap something.

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.

attributes.action: Increase the mental health budget now.
attributes.background: It's a serious issue and affects people’s physical health and the economy. Better prevention measures – access to therapies and support, faster referrals, more time to discuss with a GP versed in mental health – means better outcomes overall. We value mental health and the budget must reflect it!
attributes.additional_details: December 2016: Less and less being spent on mental health: Local authorities use less than 1% of their budget on services

attributes.action: Make living wage the same for everyone.
attributes.background:
The living wage should be the same for everyone, no matter the age, gender, race or anything else!

With bill prices rising and many younger individuals having their own houses & cars it's impossible to keep out of debt. 

If your doing the same job, role & hours you should get the same wage

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence to not report child abuse to the police.
attributes.background: many hundreds of children have suffered and continue to suffer because of institutional doubt.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is of course supported by the often late action of hundreds of whistle-blowers who should have reported their feelings much earlier than they did. This petition would remove both doubt and onus by making a legally required course of action perfectly clear to all concerned.

attributes.action: Ban all-metal manhole covers on roads
attributes.background: Having ridden motorcycles for a number or years, I have had many encounters with slippery manhole covers on roads, especially while cornering.  The change in surface grip leads to the wheels of the vehicle slipping, potentially causing serious consequences.
attributes.additional_details: There are two practical solutions; either replace the manhole covers with a non-metallic material or coating existing covers with a higher grip material.

attributes.action: make all care/rest homes have a percentage of locally funded beds
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to lose all their money, sell their property to pay for their care when they have to go into a care/residential home? Then when the money runs out, they have to move on?
attributes.additional_details: Care homes/Residential homes charge an extorionate rate for the care they provide, ranging from £800 to £1000+ per week. Some places are locally funded, whilst others are privately funded, meaning the person living there has to pay full price, for the care they receive. Locally funded places, will take into account someones pension, and will only pay some of the cost,leaving the person very little "pocket money". But atleast they have some money! All care homes/Residential homes, should allow for the fact that someones money will run out eventually and should make provisions for this, allowing the elderly person to go over to locally funded monies, without moving them on,so the elderly person, will be secure in the place they live, to live outtheir final days.

attributes.action: Regulate & cap the rent prices in London (RRR)
attributes.background: It's time for the government to take responsibility and stop ignoring their broken system. They should regulate and cap rent prices for rooms at the maximum of £550pcm. We want Responsibility, Regulation and Results (RRR).
attributes.additional_details:
Amongst all of the city wonders  London is known for its extremely high living costs - not to mention the extortionate prices private landlords are charging tenants. 

Due to inflation and low wages some Londoners are forced to work more than one job solely to pay the rent. 
 A lot of these landlords are illegally renting rooms and do not declare the income they are receiving from tenants and are charging tenants anything from £500-£850 for box rooms that can only fit a bed- this need to change!

attributes.action: Help release Iranian prisoner of conscience kept in solitary confinement 6 years
attributes.background: I am a student of Mohammad Ali Taheri and I was arrested in Iran in a peaceful demonstration in protest to his death sentence (UN Special Reporter March 2016 report: https://goo.gl/WWhzjPTo ). I have been campaigning for him for several years and I need the UK government's help to free him.
attributes.additional_details:
** http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/DE/Infoservice/Presse/Meldungen/2016/161108-MRHH-Mohammad_Ali_Taheri.html?version=2
 
** https://www.gruene-bundestag.de/presse/pressemitteilungen/2016/november/iran-freiheit-fuer-mohammad-ali-taheri-15-11-2016.html
 
** http://shaheedoniran.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/SG-Report-UNGA2016.pdf

**http://www.petertatchellfoundation.org/tag/dr-taheri/

**https://www.amnesty.org.uk/blogs/urgent-action-network/my-teacher-needs-your-urgent-help

attributes.action: HM Forces exempt Higher rate Stamp Duty on additional residential properties
attributes.background: The MOD have changed service personnels pensions, pay and allowances persistently for the worst over the last decade. To supplement their heavily reduced pensions on retirement service personnel in the past have built up property portfolios, the Government have now made this practically impossible
attributes.additional_details: In the Autumn Statement on 25 November 2015, the Chancellor of the Exchequer announced that higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax would apply from 1 April 2016 to purchases of additional residential properties, such as second homes and buy-to-let properties. With the Armed Forces numbers shrinking on a daily basis and recruitment drives failing this would be a big incentive for serving personnel to provide a return of service for exemption from Higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT).

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Reduce TV License Fee for full time students living away from home.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of full TV license for students living away from home, even for iPlayer is nonsensical as it will be ignored, not paid and cannot be policed.  A more pragmatic approach would be to have a nominal fee (eg £10) where students can provide parental details of cover at home address.

attributes.action:
Debate WAVE POWER v Fracking & Nuclear -  all 3 are Constant 
Sources of power.
attributes.background:
Other "constants" Fracking and Nuclear are dangerous and dearer, tax
gets lost, profits go overseas, amnesia over decommissioning & waste.

attributes.action: Stop the  plans, to use the hard shoulder on motorways, as an additional lane.
attributes.background: The plans to use the hard shoulder, on motorways, as an additional lane, is ill conceived and very dangerous. The hard shoulder is an EMERGENCY lane and should be kept as such. The emergency  and breakdown services will not be able to help drivers in the event of an accident or breakdown.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the emergency/breakdown services and motoring organisations, have already expressed their concern.

attributes.action: End disability discrimination through Essential Criteria for Driving Licences.
attributes.background: At present, there is no law preventing a role where the primary function is as a driver, or in the Emergency and Armed Services, to be distinct from a role requiring travel, both having an "Essential Criteria" for a "Full UK Driving licence", thus allowing for selective discrimination of disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Roles that require travel such as the following: 
https://roles.mariecurie.org.uk/VacancyInformation.aspx?VId=58439
are discriminating against disabilities whose condition affect their eligibility to drive.
While there are professions, that should be exempt, such as roles where the primary function is driving, or in Emergency and Armed Services roles, we ask parliament for roles outside these selected professions to apply to be able to list a "UK Driving Licence" as an "essential job criteria".

attributes.action: Decommission Sellafield safely and responsibly, it is too dangerous.
attributes.background:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUE2846zgCA  
This link shows you a report about the dangers of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION.
I call upon - all people in 200 miles of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION, elected members of the government,  and anyone who loves our country, and its people.
attributes.additional_details:
It came to my attention recently that the Sellafield installation is actually in a state of overloading and dangerously falling into disrepair, due to lack of investment and reductions of staff. 
I ask you all to come together to force the authorities to make the necessary decisions to ensure the safety and security of this installation, which threatens the health and lives of many uk residents.

attributes.action: All cyclists to have a basic third party insurance cover.
attributes.background: There are more and more people using bicycles these days and accidents happen. So what happens when a cyclist hits you or your vehicle and the blame is no them? Nothing because they are an uninsured vehicle, It's time for change.

attributes.action: Give retired police officers the authority to charge drivers using mobile phone
attributes.background: I spoke about this to a retired police inspector who thought it was a good idea , maybe they could get a part of the fine for there time taken to charge the person with the offence

attributes.action: Make it illegal to raise taxes while our overseas aid exceeds £5billion
attributes.background: The UK tax payers are fed up with the reckless overseas spending of the British tax payer's money while our own country is in an abysmal decline. Our front line services are failure, our roads are failing, our aged care is failing. Tax is increasing at a rate it is now causing people harm.
attributes.additional_details: The UK people are fed up with being the cash cow of Europe.  The UK is financing the unemployed throughout Europe. Road building projects throughout Europe with Portugal being a prime example.  The Aged care in the UK is a joke beyond belief. Yet the UK sends millions to China for their care system. This now needs to end.  It's the very hard labour of the British tax paying people keeping politicians in jobs that sole structure is to hand out the UK's tax payers cash.

attributes.action: In this time of Austerity, remove subsidised dining/drinking from both houses
attributes.background: We are all in this together. Savings on the public purse must be made. It is time that subsidies on food and drink are withdrawn from both houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Resume the official testing of the male contraceptive injection
attributes.background: The male contraceptive injection testing was stopped because the side effects were too dangerous. However, the side effects that this contraceptive injection has are less dangerous than the side effects of  female contraceptives.
attributes.additional_details: We want men to volunteer to continue with the testing for this contraceptive injection. This is not a bash against men, but against the people who called off the testing.

attributes.action: HGV stay in the inside lane between 6am to 8pm on motorways and dual carriageway
attributes.background: I feel a lot of the congestion caused is by one lorry overtaking another lorry and taking miles to do so , making lorries keep to the inside lane would ease a lot of this it would also save the government and the county a fortune as a lot of the road widening schemes would not be necessary ,

attributes.action: Let council tenants rent to buy - Pay rent but own your home at the end of it
attributes.background: Help all people get on the property ladder and own their own rent-to-buy council tenants after one year of living in any council property

attributes.action: Do not change or abolish the House of Lords
attributes.background: All Brexit voters post Brexit have had a lot to say about abolishing the House of Lords because they dare do their job and hold the Government accountable when trying to pass a bill through. This is a vital part of our democracy and calls for the House of Lords to be abolished should be rejected.

attributes.action: In the event of Scotland's independence all Government contracts be cancelled.
attributes.background: In recent years many vital services such as ship building has been moved to Scotland to assist in employment and local economy but at the expense of English towns and workers who have trained and been in their industries for many years.
attributes.additional_details: Portsmouth docks and ship building and repairs were moved to Scotland. Work that was originally carried out for repairs to Naval vessels in Woolston Southampton were withdrawn and now are carried out in Scotland.

attributes.action: Change the British legal system
attributes.background: Bring back the death penalty for murderers, rapists, kidnappers and pedophiles. In addition to corporal punishment for vandals and petty criminals.

attributes.action: Stop HGV vehicles using the third lane on four lane motorway sections.
attributes.background: Stop sections of motorways slowing to a crawl and causing long tail backs across three lanes.
attributes.additional_details: When HGV  vehicles block three lanes it cause other drivers to drive erratically to get past.

attributes.action: Cap unfair & ridiculous increases on commercial vehicle insurance.
attributes.background:
Our specialist commercial vehicle insurance has risen from £1800 pa to £3400 pa for no reason, we have not made a claim & now have 1 years no claims discount, Insurance company refuse to provide an answer.
This is kind of increase will result in less vehicles and therefore less employees.
attributes.additional_details:
RSA insured our specialist truck-mounted carpet cleaning machine and van set-up last year with 0 NCD for £1800, this year they are asking for £3400 even though we have earned 1 years NCD and no changes.
I have invested over £75,000 in this machine and vehicle based upon us being able to insure it, I will now have to sell the setup and make 2 staff members unemployed. I also have another setup which is renewable in Sept, if the same happens the business will go under and 8 staff become unemployed

attributes.action: Scrap Stamp Duty
attributes.background:
Stamp duty makes it very difficult to buy a first home or even move home. 
The govement have schemes to help people get on the property ladder but then tax you if you do actually buy a home.

attributes.action: A referendum to stop HS2 & spend the money on more appropriate things.
attributes.background: The previous Labour Gov't and subsequent administrations are grandstanding to create a new railway, which will make the journey between London and Birmingham 20 minutes shorter. This will destroy so many pretty villages and people's homes & at present is estimated to cost between £50 & £80 billion.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the 19th century where our Victorian forbears really were innovative and had great reasons to build. They were investing in the great Industrial revolution for it to work then and there. The HS2 project will come to "fruition" in 30 years time and by that time, it is very possible it will be out of date. Businessmen can work on trains and often this journey is beneficial to a meeting. Cutting the journey time by 20 minutes is a false economy, whilst so many other projects need funds.

attributes.action: Stop Government funding the Football Association - divert funds to other sports
attributes.background: The Government provides £30m+ of our tax payers money to the FA. The UK has the wealthiest football league in the world, so this funding needs to stop. Wealthy football clubs should invest in their own sport 100%; they have the means. Many other sports could benefit from re-direction of these funds.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/news/does-football-association-get-30-million-year-public-money/

attributes.action: Allow and train our prison officers to use PAVA spray and tasers
attributes.background: Prison officers are faced with violent incidents on a day to day basis. These can include weapons being used by some of the mode violent people in the country. Our officers are expected to be able to deal with these situations by using nothing more than control and restraint techniques. Times change

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to teach healthy relationships in schools
attributes.background: i believe the teaching of healthy relationships in school will help to bring the level of domestic abuse down and teach children and young adults what is healthy and what is not and what they can do to protect themselves

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid except for natural disaster relief.
attributes.background: Use the savings for social care for our elderly and infrastructure projects.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of student loans
attributes.background: The government wants to sell student loans off to help the treasury. Student loans are already hard enough to pay off in the current economic crisis. Many took them out because they had no choice and were assured they could pay. This has proven false. Selling them will cause more harm.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offense to vote against, or block the result of a referendum.
attributes.background:
I find it utterly outrageous that there have been politcians in the goverment who have voted against the brexit referendum despite the people winning there right to freedom.

I propose all referendums are legally binding and to hinder,block or frustrate the process will become a criminal act.
attributes.additional_details: Politicians should brace democratic processes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for DVLA to disclose drivers' details to private companies.
attributes.background: DVLA should not be allowed to give out drivers names and addresses to any person or company unless a serious offence has been committed. It should be made an offence to do so.

attributes.action: Declare the Tube an essential service and force unions into compulsory mediation
attributes.background: Tube strikes have been paralyzing London for years for all kinds of reasons. The battle between the unions and TfL management leave the public in the lurch, suffering through queues and bringing roads to a standstill. They do great damage to economy, emergency services and environment.
attributes.additional_details: Compulsory mediation would force both parties to the negotiating table and to achieve a fair outcome through mediation by an independent third party. Strikes are avoided and the public is not harmed by abstract, arcane industrial disputes.

attributes.action: Make Childcare costs tax deductible for the self employed.
attributes.background: The self employed can't afford to take time off, not just financially. If you stop being available for work your clients find someone else, you fall behind industry trends and your skills get outdated. Child care to the self employed is a must have business expense and should be tax deductible.
attributes.additional_details:
Sole traders are at the forefront of UK business growth, According to the government’s department of business, Energy & Industrial Strategy in 2016 there were 4.2 million non-employing businesses  (which are basically businesses who do not employ anyone but the owner). They account for just under 76% of the overall business population. And 89% of the business population growth since 2000.

The self employed can not survive without child care and the UK can not survive without the self employed.

attributes.action: Make all UK Employee's pay the same rate of National Insurance.
attributes.background:
National Insurance is a tax and is applied to those earning above the upper earnings limit at a lower rate to those below the upper earnings
l
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is about tax fairness nothing else.
If the current standard/base rate was applied to all employee's the extra funds collected could be used to ease NHS funding or as Government see fit .

attributes.action: Stop local councils cutting low paid jobs without first cutting top salaries.
attributes.background: Recently, Newcastle City Council approved an £8500 pay rise for its chief executive despite assurances to the contrary. Many local council chief executives earn more than the Prime Minister and yet jobs lower down the pay scale are cut to save money.
attributes.additional_details: Dan O'Donaghue's article for the chronicle drew this issue to my attention. 30/1/17

attributes.action: Ban Donald Trump from entering UK until he lifts his muslim country travel ban
attributes.background: US President Donald Trump has imposed a ban on people from seven Muslim countries entering the US. This is in contravention of the Geneva convention and is a racist and immoral act. Let him know that the people of the UK do not want him to enter our country until he lifts this ban.

attributes.action: Publish a statement reminding Donald Trump @POTUS of the UN Refugee Convention.
attributes.background: The UN Refugee Convention- Note on Non-refoulement (1977) Clearly states that "The most essential component of refugee status & of asylum is protection against return to a country where a person has reason to fear persecution. This protection has found expression in the principle of non-refoulement"
attributes.additional_details: We ask our elected politicians to send a message to the US President, that any action risking a national of a country listed in his extreme vetting exec order to be returned to the country from which they sought asylum, is a  contravention of the Convention above & more so any action will be met with sanctions, inc. the requirement for any US citizen to fully disclose financial information for the last 5 years if wishing to visit the UK, until such time the said US executive order is rescinded.

attributes.action: Issue a formal condemnation of President Trump
attributes.background: Within his first week, Donald Trump has turned the back of the world's richest country on these fleeing unimaginable horrors; has outright lied to the media of the world; and in an astonishing declaration, happily condoned torture. The UK Government should immediately condemn his presidency.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is a free nation, and should stand up for what is right. Our government is failing us by refusing to object to Donald Trump's abhorrent actions. We must not let division, injustice, and prejudice go unopposed. I believe that we must challenge these actions for the safety and dignity of our country.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from entering the UK for 90 days too in solidarity with Iran
attributes.background: The United States of America has banned the citizens of Iran, along with those of Iraq, Libya, Syria, Somalia, Sudan, Yemen from entering the country for 90 days. To make a stand against such racial profiling, let's ban them too in solidarity with our brothers in those countries.

attributes.action: Tax footy transfers >£1m to fund NHS nurses & require firms to sponsor a nurse
attributes.background: All football transfer to be taxed at vat rate go towards NHS nurses funding in whole of uk. Any firm over a set size would be required to fund a nurses salary and uniform - any additional nurse funding by the same firm could be in part allowable against tax.
